attributes.action: reverse the doubling of the interest rate of the Student Loan company loans and link it to the CPI rather than the RPI
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Student Loan Company Ltd currently pegs its interest rate to the RPI rather the the CPI (the government's official measure of inflation). 

The RPI, which includes mortgage payments therefore indirectly property prices, is an unfair measure of inflation as felt by the majority of borrowers of student loans who are not property owners and therefore not benefiting from property price increases. 

We believe the Student Loan Company loans were sold as an effective "0 percent" loan, only growing by the rate of inflation and are concerned that the doubling of interest rates at a time that the government is contemplating selling the Student Loan Company may be motivated by commercial priorities. 

The doubling of interest rate means that the average loan is now accumulating by almost £1000 per year before any capital is paid off. 

The CPI is a better measure of inflation  as experienced by most borrowers of student loans and we therefore request the Prime Minister to urgently intervene to change the Student Loan Company's policy of linking their loans to the RPI rather than the CPI.

government_responses.details:
